thread.title: Prosecutors' brief backs conviction in prep school rape case
thread.title_full: Prosecutors' brief backs conviction in prep school rape case - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: wcax.com
title: Prosecutors' brief backs conviction in prep school rape case
text:
CONCORD, N.H. (AP) - Prosecutors say the conduct of a former student at an elite New Hampshire prep school convicted of sexually assaulting a freshman days before he graduated justifies a felony conviction of using a computer to lure her for sex.
A jury in August convicted 19-year-old Owen Labrie, of Tunbridge, Vermont. His trial included lurid details that exposed a practice at St. Paul's School in Concord known as Senior Salute, in which graduating students try to have sex with younger classmates.
Labrie's lawyers want a judge to dismiss the felony conviction for using a computer to arrange their May 2014 encounter. If the conviction stands, Labrie would be ordered to register as a sex offender for life. Prosecutors say in their brief filed Thursday that it doesn't constitute cruel and unusual punishment.
